continent.title: Running out of time
continent.subtitle: Food production beats around agriculture, a sector that consume a lot of water.
continent.content: Asia depends a lot on water as its major rivers feed the rice fields and the economy that comes from it. There is a strong expansion of irrigated crops, whose area doubled between 1961 and 2003. The Himalayan glaciers serves as a source but keeps melting more and more

continent.subtitle: The part of the continent that is the more put at risk by natural disasters
continent.content: Global warming and its impact on the melting of Himalayan glaciers has increased not just the rise of geopolitical conflicts fueled by the scarcity of water resources, but in short term, the risk of flooding that puts thousand of lives in danger possibly.

continent.subtitle: National egoism overrided considerations of economic rationality and regional security.
continent.content: Since their attainment of independence, the states of Central Asia have not been able to set up a practicable system of self-use water. This remained a curb to the development of their economies and in fine, the comfort of its inhabitants.
